intro: Urochilus arbusculus, commonly known as the slender rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in dry, sunny environments. Its small, white or pinkish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the spring. Urochilus arbusculus is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands.
